name: "Dr. Ismael Kimirei" affiliation: "Tanzania Fisheries Research Institute" email: "ismael.kimirei@tafiri.go.tz" execute: warning: false message: false comment: "" --- ## Overview This training program in fisheries stock assessment has been developed through a partnership focused on building capacity for sustainable fisheries management in the Indian Ocean region, with particular emphasis on Somali fisheries. ## About TAFIRI The **Tanzania Fisheries Research Institute (TAFIRI)** is the premier fisheries research institution in East Africa, established to advance scientific knowledge and provide technical guidance for sustainable fisheries development across the region. :::{.callout-note} TAFIRI operates under the Ministry of Livestock and Fisheries and maintains collaborative relationships with international research institutions and regional fisheries organizations. ::: ### Why TAFIRI Leads This Training TAFIRI's leadership in this initiative is grounded in: | Dimension | Strength | |-----------|----------| | **Regional Expertise** | Decades of experience conducting stock assessments in Indian Ocean fisheries | | **Scientific Excellence** | Recognized experts in length-based methods, surplus production models, and data-limited approaches | | **Research Infrastructure** | Modern facilities, comprehensive databases, and professional networks across East Africa | | **Practical Experience** | Direct engagement with data-poor fisheries and context-specific assessment solutions | | **Capacity Development** | Institutional commitment to training future fisheries scientists and managers | ## Course Development Philosophy This program draws on TAFIRI's extensive research portfolio and reflects: - **Real-world relevance**: Case studies from East African and Indian Ocean fisheries - **Proven methods**: Assessment approaches tested in similar data-limited contexts - **International standards**: Alignment with FAO Technical Guidelines and best practices - **Regional solutions**: Practical approaches to challenges specific to Somali and regional fisheries ## Learning Outcomes Upon completing this training, participants will: - ‚úì Conduct stock assessments using limited and available data - ‚úì Interpret assessment results and communicate findings to decision-makers - ‚úì Support evidence-based fisheries management at regional and national levels - ‚úì Apply international assessment standards in East African contexts ## Somali Fisheries Landings Overview ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} require(sf) require(tidyverse) require(sizeMat) require(gt) require(tidyplots) require(patchwork) require(leaflet) lw = readxl::read_excel('data_shared/ProjKalluun_master_data_entry.xlsx', sheet = 'Section 3', skip= 4) |> janitor::clean_names() |> filter(!is.na(landing_site)) lw = lw |> mutate( year = year(date_dd_mm_yy), month = month(date_dd_mm_yy, label = TRUE), day = day(date_dd_mm_yy), .after = date_dd_mm_yy ) |> mutate( weight_kg = as.numeric(weight_kg), length_cm = as.numeric(length_cm) ) # Define approximate coordinates for Somali coastal regions region_coords <- tibble( region = c('Berbera', 'Borama', 'Mogadishu', 'Kismayo', 'Baidoa', 'Galkacyo'), latitude = c(10.4145, 9.5283, 2.0469, -0.3604, 3.4314, 6.7719), longitude = c(45.3682, 43.6333, 46.1996, 42.5521, 43.6635, 46.9250), landings = c(NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA) ) # Get landing counts by region landing_counts <- lw |> filter(!is.na(region)) |> group_by(region) |> tally() |> rename(landings = n) # Merge coordinates with landing counts region_map_data <- region_coords |> left_join(landing_counts, by = 'region') |> mutate(landings = coalesce(landings.y, landings.x), landings = coalesce(landings, 0)) |> select(region, latitude, longitude, landings) # Create color palette based on landing counts pal <- leaflet::colorNumeric(palette = 'YlOrRd', domain = region_map_data$landings) # Create leaflet map leaflet(region_map_data) |> addTiles() |> addCircleMarkers( lng = ~longitude, lat = ~latitude, radius = ~sqrt(landings) / 2, popup = ~paste0('', region, '
Landings: ', landings), color = ~pal(landings), fillColor = ~pal(landings), fillOpacity = 0.7, weight = 2, opacity = 0.8 ) |> addLegend( pal = pal, values = ~landings, title = 'Number of Landings', position = 'bottomright' ) |> setView(lng = 46, lat = 5, zoom = 6) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
